references.paper_title: Inferring learning rules from animal decision-making
references.reason: This paper is highly relevant because it directly addresses the problem of inferring learning rules from behavioral data, a core theme of the current paper.

references.paper_title: Dopaminergic neurons write and update memories with cell-type-specific rules
references.reason: This paper is highly relevant because it provides biological grounding for the model used in the current paper, focusing on the role of dopaminergic neurons in synaptic plasticity.

references.paper_title: Learning and memory using drosophila melanogaster: a focus on advances made in the fifth decade of research
references.reason: This paper provides key biological background for the fly experiment, outlining the role of the mushroom body in learning and memory.

references.paper_title: Inferring learning rules from distributions of firing rates in cortical neurons
references.reason: This paper presents a method to infer plasticity rules from firing rates, providing a conceptual and methodological foundation for the work done in the current paper.

references.paper_title: Reward expectations direct learning and drive operant matching in drosophila
references.reason: This paper is among the most important because it provides empirical data from a Drosophila experiment which the current paper uses to validate its approach.
